page.title: 02Farming at Ridgeway
page.content: Two farms lie to the east of Main Road, Ridgeway. The higher is the 84 acre,{High Lane Farm,}which is managed by{Mr. Green}and one worker. They graze 100{sheep}and drill for{barley, {and root crops}in the spring.{Sheep {dipping}takes place in summer and is under police supervision.{Shearing}is also a summer job. Autumn is{harvest} time and the land is drilled for{ {winter barley}and{wheat.}The sheep are sheltered and fed on concentrates. {Mr. Varney}and 3 men manage the lower 450 acre{Church Farm.}In spring, 150{cattle}graze and{crops}are planted. In summer{barley}is harvested. Autumn is{potato harvest} and the cattle are fattened for slaughter. Winter is{barley}sowing time.
